DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Disease Organ System Personal Medical History Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the text field to specify the personal medical history of concomitant diseases or disorders.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Disease Organ System Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the personal medical history of concomitant diseases or disorder of an anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure that consists of organs and organ subclasses responsible for certain body functions.  Representative examples are the gastrointestinal system, urinary system, and hematopoietic system.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
